definition: in truth (often tends to intensify), the syllable naming the fifth (dominant) note of any musical scale in solmization
details:
adverb
- in truth (often tends to intensify)
= synonyms: indeed
- (used to introduce a logical conclusion) from that fact or reason or as a result
= synonyms: therefore, hence, thence, thus
- subsequently or soon afterward (often used as sentence connectors)
= synonyms: then, and so, and then
- in a manner that facilitates
= example: in a manner that facilitates
- in the way indicated
= example: in the way indicated
= synonyms: thus, thusly
- to a very great extent or degree
= example: to a very great extent or degree
- to an extent or degree as expressed
= example: to an extent or degree as expressed
- in such a condition or manner, especially as expressed or implied
= example: in such a condition or manner, especially as expressed or implied
- to a certain unspecified extent or degree
= example: to a certain unspecified extent or degree
- in the same way
noun
- the syllable naming the fifth (dominant) note of any musical scale in solmization
= synonyms: soh, sol
